Vocabularies.Definition: a. of more than one culture （融合）多种文化的
n. writer of a book, play, etc. （书、剧本等的）作者，作家
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Dickens is my favorite author.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    an assemblage of diverse fragments; picture made by an unusual combination of bits of paper, cloth, photographs, metal, etc. 大杂烩；（用纸片、碎布、照片、金属等制成的）美术拼贴画
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a collage of conflicting memories

Vocabularies.Definition: losing strength; declining 衰落中；衰退中
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He is still one of the world's most popular tennis players, but his game is in decline.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    欠款；负债
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He had enough money to pay off his father's debts.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  person who withdraws from conventional society or school 逃避现实社会的人；中途退学者
n.  special mark or quality 特点，特征，特性
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Genes determine the characteristics of every living thing.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   power, energy 活力；精力
n. the quality of pushing 积极进取
vt.  make ineffective; make (sb.) lose the ability to move part or all of the body 使失去功能；使瘫痪
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He had a minor stroke in 1987, which left him partly paralyzed.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  (pl theses)		论题，论点；论文, 毕业（或学位）论文
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Their main thesis is that inflation is caused by increase in the money supply.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  concerning past events; based on the study of history 历史（上）的；史学的 historically  ad. 以历史观点；在历史上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Museums collect objects of scientific, aesthetic, or historical importance.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   earlier happening, decision, etc. taken as an example or rule for what comes later 先例；惯例 e.g.  The trial could set an important precedent for dealing with large numbers of similar cases.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: feel/ believe/ realize that 感到；意识到 e.g.  As soon as we had the sense that something was wrong, we moved the children away.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    centered upon Europe 以欧洲为中心的；（主要）与欧洲（人）有关的
a.  of or relating to Spain and other Spanish-speaking countries; of or relating to Spanish-speaking people or their culture 西班牙和讲西班牙语国家的；讲西班牙语人的; 西班牙文化的
never before 第一次 e.g.  Korea entered into the quarter-finals in the World Cup for the first time.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. without precedent; never done or known before 无前例的；空前的 e.g.  unprecedented levels of unemployment
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   the quality of not being closed 开放
n. 多元主义；多元文化
a. 多中心（论）的；多中心主义的
cause (sth.) to remain; fail or forget to bring or take 留下，遗留；未能（或忘记）带 e.g.  I am afraid we'll have to leave the dog behind at home.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   evaluating other peoples and cultures according to assumptions or preconceptions originating in the standards and customs of one's own people or culture 种族（或民族）中心主义的；种族（或民族）优越感的
a.  of a tribe or tribes 部落的
n.  characteristic attitude of mind; way of thinking 心理状态；思想方法
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Can you understand the mentality of someone who likes to watch animals fighting each other?

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    previous notice or warning; a feeling that sth., esp. sth. bad, will happen 预示，预告；（尤指不祥的）预感
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The day before her accident, she had a premonition of something horrible.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  made up of or relating to people of many races 多民族的， 多种族的
a.  多元的，多种的；复数的 n. 复数
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His government has pledged to move the country towards a plural democracy.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a person who moves as a settler to another country 移民
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Historically, the United States has attracted vast numbers of immigrants from around the globe.

Vocabularies.Definition: n., a.  朝鲜人（的）；朝鲜语（的）；朝鲜的
n., a.  老挝人（的）；老挝语（的）；老挝的
n., a.  越南人（的）；越南语（的）；越南的
n., a.  柬埔寨人（的）；柬埔寨语（的）；柬埔寨的
n., a.    墨西哥人（的）；墨西哥西班牙语（的）；墨西哥的
n., a.   萨尔瓦多人（的）；萨尔瓦多的
n., a.   危地马拉人（的）；危地马拉的
n., a.  伊朗人（的）；伊朗语（的）；伊朗的
n., a.  亚美尼亚人（的）； 亚美尼亚的
n., a.  墨西哥裔美国人（的）
a.    深色皮肤的；皮肤黝黑的
vt.  improve the aesthetic appearance of (a piece of land) by planting trees and shrubs, etc.  对（土地）作景观美化n. scenery of an area of land  （陆上）风景
a.  involving or requiring advanced technological development 高科技的
a., n.  巴基斯坦的；巴基斯坦人（的）
n., a.   穆斯林（的）
a.  天主教的		n.  天主教徒
a.    亚洲儒教的；亚洲儒教徒的
n.  connected system 网状系统，网络
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The Internet is composed of many interconnected computer networks.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. not yet fully grown or developed 不发达的，未充分发育（或发展）的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  underdeveloped countries

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   selfish use, use for one's own benefit    利用；剥削
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  full exploitation of oil wells

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  having a useful purpose; helpful  建设性的；有裨益的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Criticism is welcome only when it is constructive criticism.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   不发达（或未充分发展）的状况
a., n.  非白种人（的）
n.   working or acting together for a common purpose 合作；协作
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The mission of the United Nations is to maintain world peace, develop good relations between countries, promote cooperation in solving the world's problems, and encourage respect for human rights.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   idea about what sth. is like or understanding of sth.; process in which sb. forms a plan or idea 观念，概念；构想
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Their conception of love seems to be very different from our own.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. causing destruction 毁灭（性）的；破坏（性）的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Technology can be conceived as both a creative and a destructive process.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   算术的
a.  非西方的   n. 非西方人
put in an appearance; be present 出现；出席
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  If I don't show up for class this morning, I'll be kicked out.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   hurt the feelings of; give offence to 伤…的情感； 得罪
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Richard was deeply offended that people thought he'd faked the story.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  哲学家；哲人
as far as ... is concerned 在…意义上
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  In the environmental sense, your plan to build a chemical factory is a disaster, whatever the economic benefits may seem to be.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    人类学的
n. picture or pattern that is  made by fitting together differently colored bits of stone, etc.; sth. resembling a mosaic 镶嵌画, 镶嵌图案；镶嵌画般的东西
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a rich mosaic of meadows, rivers and woods

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  宗教信仰；宗教
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Philosophy comprised all areas of speculative thought and included the arts, science, and religion.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.   (cause to) go under the surface of water; cover or completely hide（使）沉没；淹没；遮盖
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Submarines are designed to submerge and surface, and to maneuver quietly underwater to avoid detection.

Vocabularies.Definition: from the viewpoint of 从…的观点来看
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  From the perspective of women, the article is well worth reading.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   of a race or the races of mankind 人种的；种族的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Although America's culture is becoming more uniform, its society remains a diverse mix of ethnic, racial, and religious groups.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. bring into harmony or agreement 使和谐；使一致 harmonious a. in agreement; free from ill feeling 和谐的；和睦的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The cottages harmonize well with the landscape.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. fundamental; most important; necessary 基本的；最重要的；必要的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Most teachers agree that play is an essential part of a child's development.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. joining or putting together; state of being joined 联合，结合；组合
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. It is the combination of wit and political analysis that makes his articles so readable.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 地理（学）的
n. （社会地位等的）变动；流动性
a. unchanging; still and stale 停滞的；静止的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Thousands of disputes between management and labor resulted from stagnant wages coupled with inflation.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. one's fate 命运
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. She wanted to be an artist, but destiny decreed that she should become a doctor.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. take away the courage or confidence of 使气馁；使沮丧
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Michael was so discouraged by repeated failures that he decided to give up his project.
